title: Chelsea superstar Eden Hazard: I knew we would be champions again
text:
GETTY Eden Hazard is back to his best after a stunning goal against Arsenal last weekend 
The Stamford Bridge superstar admits the rest of football doubted that, after last season’s 10th-place finish. 
But Hazard, 26, insists it was that “very bad season” which has been the motivation for Chelsea to put things right and regain the title they won two years ago – and prove the doubters wrong. 
The brilliant Belgian is also back to the form which saw him win three individual awards that season – FWA Footballer of the Year and Player of the Year with the PFA and Chelsea. Chelsea train ahead of Burnley clash Friday, 10th February 2017 CHELSEA trained ahead of Sunday's clash with Burnley at Turf Moor. 1 / 16 Chelsea FC via Getty Images Pedro and David Luiz train with Chelsea “I think most people were thinking that Chelsea could be top four but not champions” Chelsea winger Eden Hazard 
Ahead of today’s match at Burnley , Hazard said: “At the start of the season everyone was thinking, ‘Chelsea are a good team with a new manager in Antonio Conte but I don’t know if they can contend for the title’. But within the team, we know each other and we knew we were ready to win. 
“Maybe outside, people saw it differently. I think most people were thinking that Chelsea could be top four but not champions. 
“Now, though, we are top of the league, so we just want to stay there. We are motivated by being in a good position, but also because last season was very bad. 
“So we want to be there again, to be at the top again, for the fans. This is why we are top now.” Related videos
